definition: to be accustomed to (a certain lifestyle etc)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Being accustomed to being poor, people can not easily adapt to a wealthy life in a short period of time.
sentences.chinese: 过惯了穷日子，人们短期内不能适应富裕的生活。

sentences.english: I used to live alone before I knew you.
sentences.chinese: 认识你之前，我过惯了一个人的生活。

sentences.english: Eg . The oldman and his wife have been used to living a simple life.
sentences.chinese: 这对老夫妇已经过惯了简朴的生活。

sentences.english: His uncle said he' d never get married ; he' s a confirmed bachelor .
sentences.chinese: 他叔叔说他永远不会结婚，因为他过惯了单身生活。

sentences.english: Are used to a superior comfortable life, Xiao Yang, from Shanghai to Munich study.
sentences.chinese: 过惯了优越舒适生活的肖扬从上海来到慕尼黑留学。

sentences.english: When we get comfortable with a certain way of life we get lazy.
sentences.chinese: 当我们过惯了舒服的生活后，我们就会变得怠惰。

sentences.english: He'll never get married. He's a confirmed bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 他永远不会结婚，因为他过惯了单身生活。

sentences.english: Life on a farm is a far cry from what I've been used to.
sentences.chinese: 农场生活与我已过惯的日子迥然不同。

sentences.english: His uncle said he' d never get married ; he' s a confirmed bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 他叔叔说他永久不会完婚，由于他过惯了独身生存。

sentences.english: A commander's salary was modest, and Rhoda was used to this better life.
sentences.chinese: 一个中校的薪水不多，而罗达是过惯比较好的生活的。

definition: brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
to lodge under another person's roof (idiom); to live relying on sb else's charity
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to live one's life/to make a living
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
